meanings.definition: The first day of the month in the ancient Roman calendar.
meanings.sent1: On the kalends, people in ancient Rome would gather for celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The kalends marked the beginning of each month in the old Roman calendar.
meanings.sent3: The baker mistakenly thought today was the kalends and baked extra bread.
meanings.sent4: Her birthday felt like the kalends of a new year, full of promise and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The kalends were like a fresh start, a chance to begin anew every month.

meanings.definition: The first day of the month in the Roman calendar, occurring on the first day of March, May, July, and October, and on the fifth day of the other months.
meanings.sent1: In March, the kalends fell on the first day of the month.
meanings.sent2: People in ancient Rome would pay their debts on the kalends.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think every day was the kalends, demanding treats non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The kalends of March brought with it the promise of spring and new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The kalends of each month were like little milestones to mark the passage of time.
